text: Cabassus or Kabassos (), or Cabessus or Kabessos (Καβησσός), or Kabissos, was a town of ancient Cataonia or Cappadocia between Tarsus and Mazaca. It was inhabited during Roman and Byzantine times. Its site is tentatively located west of Cucusus near Doğanbeyli, Asiatic Turkey. ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Cataonia Category:Populated places in ancient Cappadocia Category:Former populated places in Turkey Category:Populated places of the Byzantine Empire Category:Roman towns and cities in Turkey Category:History of Adana Province
title: Cabassus
